Key Arguments: The government should not have the authority to assess the validity of public comments without allowing the same scrutiny of its own statements.
The legislation demeans the public by implying they cannot discern truth from misinformation.
There is ambiguity in what constitutes relevant 'online' sites under this legislation.
Concerns about the implications for quoting misinformation as part of legitimate opinion or discussion.
Notable Quotes: Why does the Government believe it can appoint an authority to assess the validity of comments of people yet it will not permit this same authority to assess what the government says?
The digital platform providers will be required to be a fount of knowledge.
